item.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications: Flashcards for a Book Club
item.description:
How did we get here

Back when I left Reco, my parting gift to everyone at the company was books ðŸ“š. At the time, these were books I haven’t read, but were recommended by the interwebz. The idea was to stay in touch with the team by gifting them good books and loaning them from time to time. That’s how I wrote a book report about “Turn the Ship Around”, for example.

As part of my work at Orca Security, I’ve been conducting a weekly book club, where we read Designing Data-Intensive Applications by Martin Kleppmann. Well, weekly-ish. You know how schedules are. And it was fun!
